author: David Maddock
title: Liverpool ready to change keepers AGAIN to help Jurgen Klopp decide on potential summer move for Joe Hart
text:
Sport Liverpool ready to change keepers AGAIN to help Jurgen Klopp decide on potential summer move for Joe Hart Reds boss wants to give Loris Karius a run in the side after recent Simon Mignolet errors — and what he sees will determine their interest in the Man City star Share Mignolet (right) started the season in goal, was dropped for Karius, but got reinstated in December (Photo: AMA/Getty) Share     
Simon Mignolet is set to be axed again by Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp. 
Goalkeeper Mignolet , who was singled out for criticism by manager Klopp last weekend, will be a victim as the German gets tough with his out-of-form Reds. 
Loris Karius is likely to be recalled in place of Mignolet, while Klopp looks certain to bring back Giorginio Wijnaldum in midfield and Divock Origi may also get a starting opportunity up front. 
Mignolet started the season in the team but Klopp made clear early on that summer-buy Karius was his number one, only for a string of disappointing performances to offer the Belgian a surprise reprieve in December. Klopp wants Karius to prove himself — and would then be free to sell Mignolet (Photo: Getty) 
But high-profile errors against Chelsea last Wednesday and then Hull three days later have forced Klopp to reconsider, and he is now ready to give Karius another chance... and hasten Mignolet's departure from Anfield. 
His sale in the summer could finance a move for England No1 Joe Hart , although Liverpool have not so far considered the Manchester City star spending the season on loan at Torino as a target. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
